structured.description: A `Camera3D` class that handles 3D camera functionality. It includes a constructor that initializes the camera's matrices and a method for calculating the projection matrix based on viewport size and aspect ratio. The `processInput()` method processes mouse and keyboard input to rotate and move an object based on its transform, and multiplies the movement speed by 10 when the 'LShift' key is pressed. The code also includes a `move()` method for moving the object along a given direction by a specified distance.

items.description: is an extension of the Camera class that processes mouse and keyboard input to rotate and move an object based on its transform. It also multiplies the movement speed by 10 when the 'LShift' key is pressed. The processInput method calculates the movement amount based on the user's input and moves the object along a specified direction using the getTransform().add() method.
items.name: Camera3D

items.description: calculates a matrix representing the camera's perspective projection, based on the given `CameraStruct` data.

params.name: data
params.description:
3D camera parameters, which are used to compute the perspective projection matrix.

* `getAsMatrix4()` is a method that returns a `Matrix4f` object representing the camera's projection matrix.

The function then assigns this projection matrix to a variable called `projection`.

returns.description:
a Matrix4f object representing the projection matrix as defined by the input `CameraStruct` data.

The `Matrix4f` object that is returned represents a 4x4 matrix, which encodes the perspective projection transformation. The matrix has the following elements:

* The upper left 3x3 submatrix represents the viewport transform, with the origin at the center of the viewport and the dimensions of the viewport set by the `viewport` field in the `CameraStruct`.
* The lower right 1x4 submatrix represents the projection transform, which maps the 3D scene coordinates to the image plane. The elements of this submatrix are determined by the `projection` field in the `CameraStruct`.

items.name: calculateProjectionMatrix

items.description: is a subclass of the Camera Struct class and provides additional functionality for handling 3D camera movements. It has fields for fov, aspect, zNear, and zFar, which are used to calculate the perspective matrix, and a method for getting the perspective matrix as a Matrix4f object.
items.name: CameraStruct3D

items.description: initializes a `Matrix4f` object representing a perspective projection matrix with the specified field of view (fov), aspect ratio, near and far distances.

returns.description:
a 4x4 matrix representing a perspective projection matrix.

The `Matrix4f` object returned by the function is an instance of the Matrix4f class, which represents a 4x4 matrix in homogeneous coordinates.

The `initPerspective` method used to create the matrix sets the field of view (fov) in radians, the aspect ratio of the image, the near plane distance (zNear), and the far plane distance (zFar). These values determine the perspective projection of the 3D space, where objects appear smaller as they recede into the distance.

The matrix returned by the function is a representation of the viewing transformation that maps 3D points from the world coordinate system to the screen coordinate system, taking into account the perspective projection.

items.name: getAsMatrix4

comment.description: Rotates a `Vector3f` object by an angle about an arbitrary axis, resulting in a new quaternion representation of the rotation.

params.name: axis
params.description: 3D vector that defines the rotation axis.

params.name: angle
params.description: 3D rotation angle of the object being rotated around the specified axis.

comment.description: Computes the rotation required to face a specified point while maintaining a given upward direction.

params.name: point
params.description: 3D position of the point that the code should look at.

params.name: up
params.description: 3D direction perpendicular to the line of sight and used to calculate the rotation needed to look at the provided point.

comment.description: Computes a quaternion representation of a rotation that looks at a given point from a specified direction. The function takes a point and an up vector as input, and returns a quaternion representing the desired rotation.

params.name: point
params.description: 3D point that the look-at rotation should be applied to.

params.name: up
params.description: 3D direction perpendicular to the look-at point, which is used to create a rotation matrix that aligns with the local coordinate system of the function.

returns.description: a quaternion representing the rotation necessary to look at a point in space from a specified starting position and orientation.

comment.description: Sets the `parent` field of an object to a given `Transform` instance, allowing for the inheritance of transform properties and layout management.

params.name: parent
params.description: 3D transform of the parent object to which the current object will be attached or moved relative to.

comment.description: Sets the position of a component or object to the input vector.

params.name: pos
params.description: 3D position of the entity to which the method is being called, and it is assigned to the `pos` field of the class.

comment.description: Updates the position of an object by adding a vector to its current position.

params.name: addVec
params.description: 3D vector to be added to the position of the object, and its value is used to calculate the new position of the object.

comment.description: Sets the rotational orientation of an object by assigning a provided `Quaternion` instance to the object's `rot` field.

params.name: rotation
params.description: 4D quaternion that specifies the rotational transformation to be applied to the object's orientation.

comment.description: Sets the scaling factor for an object, affecting its size and proportions.

params.name: scale
params.description: 3D scaling factor for the entity, which is applied to its dimensions to transform it.

structured.description: A `Shader` class that loads and manages OpenGL shaders. It provides methods for binding the shader program, uniform floats and matrices, and validating the program. The code also includes functions for loading shader source code from files and creating the shader programs.

items.description: from the file provides a way to load and manage shaders in OpenGL. It allows for the creation of a vertex shader and a fragment shader, which can be linked together to create a program. The class also provides methods for uniform floats and matrices, as well as validation and logging functions to ensure proper functioning of the shader program.
items.name: Shader

items.description: glues a program to the current GL context, enabling its use for rendering.
items.name: bind

items.description: retrieves the value of a field called `program`.
items.name: getProgram

items.description: in Java is a method that sets floating-point values to GL uniform locations based on the length of an array of values passed as a parameter.

params.name: name
params.description: 0-based index of the uniform location in the program's layout, which is used to determine the correct GL function to call for the given number of input values.

usage.code:
Shader shader = new Shader(0); // Create a shader object using a 0 program ID
shader.uniformf("uniform1", 1.0, 2.0, 3.0); // Set the value of the "uniform1" uniform to (1.0, 2.0, 3.0)

items.name: uniformf

items.description: sets a 4x4 uniform matrix value using the `glUniformMatrix4` method and storing it in a location specified by a name parameter.

params.name: name
params.description: 0-based index of the uniform location where the matrix is to be stored.

params.name: mat
params.description:
4x4 homogeneous transformation matrix that is to be uniformized.

* `name`: A string representing the name of the uniform location where the matrix will be stored.
* `mat`: A `Matrix4f` object representing a 4x4 floating-point matrix. This object contains the matrix data in its linear data, which is passed to the `glUniformMatrix4` function to store the matrix at the specified location.

items.name: unifromMat4

items.description: retrieves the location of a uniform named `name` within a program's GPU using `GL20.glGetUniformLocation`.

params.name: name
params.description: 0-based index of a uniform location within a program specified by the `program` argument, which is passed as a GL20 object to the `glGetUniformLocation()` function.

returns.description: an integer representing the location of a uniform in a GPU program.

items.name: getLoaction

items.description: loads a shader program from a file, creating and validating the program upon successful loading. It returns a new `Shader` object representing the loaded program.

params.name: filename
params.description: name of the shader file to be loaded.

returns.description:
a new instance of the `Shader` class, representing a shader program created by combining a vertex shader and a fragment shader.

* `program`: The program object created by `glCreateProgram()` is stored in the variable `program`. This object represents the linked shader program that can be used for rendering.
* `Shader`: The `Shader` class instance is returned as the output of the function, which contains information about the shader program, including its program object and other relevant details.

items.name: loadShader

items.description: creates a new shader object, loads shader source code from a string, compiles it, and attaches the resulting shader to a program object.

params.name: target
params.description: type of shader to create, with values ranging from 0 (vertex shader) to 1 (fragment shader).

params.name: src
params.description: source code for the shader to be compiled.

params.name: program
params.description: 3D graphics program that the loaded shader will be attached to and used by.

items.name: loadShader

items.description: verifies the linking and validation of a GPU program. It checks for errors during linking and validation, printing an error message to the console if any occur, and exits the program with a failure status if necessary.

params.name: program
params.description: 3D program that needs to be validated and linked.

items.name: validateProgram

items.description: reads the contents of a specified file as a string, handling potential IOExceptions.

params.name: file
params.description: file from which to read the text.

returns.description: a string representation of the contents of the specified file.

items.name: getText

structured.description: A class called `Texture` that handles loading and binding textures in an OpenGL context. The class has three methods: `bind()`, which binds the texture to a specific texture slot; `bind(int samplerSlot)`, which binds the texture to a specific texture slot; and `getID()`, which returns the ID of the texture. The code also includes a static method called `loadTexture()` that loads an image file into a texture object.

items.description: in this code loads and manages textures for use in a graphics pipeline. It takes a filename as its constructor parameter, loads the texture from the file using `ImageIO.read()`, and then binds the texture to the GPU using `glBindTexture()`. The class also provides methods for binding the texture to specific sampler slots (`bind()` and `bind(int)`) and returning the ID of the loaded texture (`getID()`).
items.name: Texture

items.description: 0 is called, performing an operation related to binding.
items.name: bind

items.description: sets the active texture slot to a specific index (0-31) and binds a texture using the specified slot and ID.

params.name: samplerSlot
params.description: 0-based index of a texture slot that the function binds to the current GL context, with valid values ranging from 0 to 31.

items.name: bind

items.description: retrieves the value of a class instance field `id`.

returns.description: an integer representing the ID of the object.

items.name: getID

items.description: loads an image file into a texture object, using ImageIO to read the image and GL11 to create and bind the texture. It then sets texture wrapping and filtering parameters and calls `glTexImage2D` to upload the image data to the GPU. Finally, it generates mipmap levels and sets the texture's minimum filter to linear-mipmap linear.

params.name: fileName
params.description: name of the texture file to be loaded and read by the function.

returns.description: an integer identifier of a generated texture.

items.name: loadTexture
